title: Can we get a battle mage?
body:
Like a semi tanky, ap Melee caster mage (not galio). I may have seen an idea for this before but something along the lines of a monk with a Bo staff.

Edit: Holy shit, i just saw this had near 1000 views and was top page of C&C thanks guys.

Morde is literally a battlemage, exactly. He is a mage, who uses melee weapons, who thrives in the thick of battle. If you do not consider him a battlemage, then you don't know what a battlemage is and you have grabbed a random title to describe what you want.
mordekaiser is nothing like a battlemage. Only thing that makes him magey is that he is ap. But if you look at it from a non ingame/stat perspective he is not a battlemage.

In game he is a battlemage, but thematically (while we dont know a lot) he is more of a lich than a battlemage. Although we know very little of his ability we do know he relied on his immortality a lot during his battles.

Im looking for someone who uses more equal parts magical ability and fighting prowess.

> Bo staff.

This peeves me to no end!
 bō (棒: ぼう), is a very tall and long **staff** weapon used in Okinawa and feudal Japan.
When you say "Bo staff" you are saying "staff staff"...

Bo Staff is the English name for a Japanese weapon. 
You won't expect Japanese people to pronounce "Hotdog" rather than "Hottodoggu", now would you?

But I can understand you. Master Sifu from Kung Fu Panda series, means "Master Master".

> Bo Staff is the English name for a Japanese weapon.

It's not. I know i sound like i'm just being overly picky too people who don't understand how language translation works, but "Bo staff" is redundant. It's the same as saying "katana sword" or "zweihander sword". "Bo" is the name of the weapon, pronunciation has nothing to do with this. "master sifu" also peeves me lol most Americans don't speak anything other than english so these errors rarely get corrected do to ignorance. Just like when you see some non-english speaker in another country wearing a shirt that says "I F*CK MY MOTHER" and they have no idea what it means.
Oh trust me they know exactly what it means

There's a reason that there's a DORD (Department of Redundancy Department) and the RAS Syndrome (Redundant Acronym Syndrome Syndrome).

There's actually a word to describe place names that fall under the DORD's area, even: tautological.

DC comics is Detective Comics Comics
Lake Tahoe is Lake Lake
Le Brea Tar Pits is The Tar Tar Pits
Sahara Desert is Desert Desert

ATM machine is Automated Teller Machine Machine

Chai Tea is Tea Tea

Avenue Road in Toronto (need I say more)
Street Road in Pennsylvania (god love the person who named it)

Ahi Tuna is Tuna Tuna
LCD display is Liquid Crystal Display Display
The Rock of Gibraltar is The Rock of the Rock of Tariq
East Timor is East East
Timor Leste is STILL East East

Queso Cheese is Cheese Cheese
Salsa Sauce is Sauce Sauce
The Los Angeles Angels is _The The Angels Angels_
Naan Bread is Bread Bread
Panini Sandwich is just horrible. A Panino is a sandwich, and panini is plural. So Panini Sandwich is Sandwiches Sandwich
PIN number is Personal Identification Number Number
RAS syndrome is Redundant Acronym Syndrome Syndrome
DORD, since we're here, is the Department of Redundancy Department

El Camino Way is The Way Way
Walla Walla River is Little River River (Walla is River, Walla Walla is Little River - otherwise it'd be River River River)
Eas Fors Waterfall, in Scotland, is a stupendous offender: Waterfall Waterfall Waterfall. Scottish Gaelic, Norse, and English.
Laguna Lake is Lake Lake (California, what on earth)

Lakeville Lake in Michigan.

Kind Sir you should specify that you are looking for someone whose main theme is "The Battle Mage" and not someone who just "plays" like one.
It's also worth noting that "battle mage" is very loose theme, it can mean many different thing - "mage who specialise in battle magic", "mage who loves to battle", "mage who can win entire battles by himself", "mage trained for battle"... the list goes on.
Probably proper theme you are looking for is "The Spellsword" - a character that combines both arcane/elemental magic, some kind of (enchanted) armor and a weapon.

While characters stated by others fit into "mage/warrior" achetype none of them is "spellsword" in its core.
E.g. one could say that {{champion:44}} fits into this theme - "he uses melee weapon and magic hur dur..." - but he is more of "a star/gem battle cleric" in his core (he was "a gem paladin" before his rework but now both Garen and Leona fit paladin theme better than he).

I looked into Battlemages, and using inspiration from Dragon Age and KoA, I've come up with this skillset. If anyone wants to flesh it out, go for it. :)

Passive: Regains 1-5% (based on level) of his mana when struck by an auto attack.

Q: Empowers his autoattacks to deal damage over time for 5 seconds

W: Blinks to a target location

E: Charges for 3 seconds, then gains a shield for 50-75% (based on level) of the damage taken in that 3 seconds, blasting back 50% of the damage taken as magic damage in a short range aoe

R: Blasts a force of elemental energy in a cone, dealing magic damage and pulling enemies towards him, as well as gaining bonus armor and magic resist depending on how many enemies were pulled

I hope this helps a little bit.

A Dragon Age type of battlemage theme would be awesome. Between LoL and Dragon Age, I'd probably sooner replay Inquisition (a third time) or DA2 (a fourth time) instead of doing LoL, if I only had time for one.
